channel.title: Stocks
channel.description: Ok well anyways in my financial class we are playing this stock game on the computer is there anyone that knows some good stock companys?

item.title: Stocks
item.dc:creator: @Greeny Greeny
item.description:
@Greeny wrote:

Try considering a hydrogen battery company, as they are the future atm.

Read full topic

item.title: Stocks
item.dc:creator: @BlackThursday BlackThursday
item.description:
@BlackThursday wrote:

I was looking at Green Energy stocks, but it seems it’s a little early to jump in on them quite yet.

Back in 2005 there was a big spike (little mini-boom of biofuels I guess). Ever since then, it’s been hit or miss. But hey, invest now cause there’s a big boom about to happen soon. Hang in there.

Read full topic

item.title: Stocks
item.dc:creator: @xxlegitxx xxlegitxx
item.description:
@xxlegitxx wrote:

What Intel giveth, Microsoft taketh away.

Read full topic

item.title: Stocks
item.dc:creator: @ruler ruler
item.description:
@ruler wrote:

I have used Vista for over 3 months now. Microsoft Operating system historically always uses more resources then their predecessor. Software drives Hardware. Something has to suck up all those extra clock cycles intel adds. Virtualization is going suck up even more when it goes mainsteam.

Windows Server 2008 will come out soon, with it ill have a reason to buy a quad core for a desktop.
I don’t use Linux for desktop use, thou i will probably run it in Windows Server 2008.

Buy INTC this Monday and sell it on Friday.
Buy MSFT before the 3rd Fed meeting this year. Sell it in December of 08

Read full topic

item.title: Stocks
item.dc:creator: @The_Un-Named The Un-Named
item.description:
@The_Un-Named wrote:

[quote=“magma828, post:1, topic:172786”][quote author=fellixombc link=topic=232479.msg1990289#msg1990289 date=1200038547]

Microsoft fails, Vista is by far the worst product they put out, well, almost as bad as Windows ME.

halve the people i know who say this don’t even try using windows vista. More people like it then xp. Vista can handle more games. But microsoft stock is worth investing in, like word.
[/quote]
Vista is “better” but the more of a computer expert you are, the less you like it.[/quote]

No, it’s not better. It runs faster because it reserves ram, other than that XP will probably win on all benchmark tests.

Read full topic

item.title: Stocks
item.dc:creator: @zammyking111 zammyking111
item.description:
@zammyking111 wrote:

Its lasting for 300 more days.

xxlegitxx:

zammyking, you can’t expect to make money off random stocks people name. If it were that easy, the stock market would be in ruins. You need to do thorough research and look into whispers about new releases. MacRumors is always great for anticipating when Apple stock will skyrocket. Just look for news of a significant release.

Its a game…

Read full topic

item.title: Stocks
item.dc:creator: @R.I.P_RSC R.I.P RSC
item.description:
@R.I.P_RSC wrote:

If the game lasts for a while, try buying some stocks from companys that sell a lot in the summer. If the game doesn’t last that long, I am of no help. I don’t have time to look into the American stock market.

Read full topic

item.title: Stocks
item.dc:creator: @juju juju
item.description:
@juju wrote:

microsoft/vista fud is in use in this thread.

a lil bit of advice, microsoft stocks are weak and have been weak for a long time - where you’re getting these ideas that investing in microsoft is good is unknown to me.

Read full topic

item.title: Stocks
item.dc:creator: @Greeny Greeny
item.description:
@Greeny wrote:

I don’t own any but often up and coming companies, ie just search for some companies bringing out new technologies or larger companies bringing out new releases (of epic proportions).

A good one atm is BluRay, it hasn’t launched fully yet in the UK but already HD-DVD is failing. BluRay in the next year or two is going to skyrocket, especially when the price comes down. So as much as I hate to say it, Sony is a good choice right now.

Read full topic
